Bela, polbela, črna ali polnozrnata?
V gospodinjstvu uporabljamo številne vrste moke, ki se razlikujejo tudi po tipu; ta označuje način mletja, dele žitnih zrn ter vsebnost snovi.
02 Nov 2019, 10:11 by Alenka Kociper



Riževa ne vsebuje glutena. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images



Še vedno uporabimo največ moke iz žit. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images



Iz različnih vrst in tipov moke pečemo pisano paleto kruha. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images


Moka je za večino ljudi pomemben del vsakodnevne prehrane; iz nje so kruh, pica, zavitki in bureki, torte in druge sladice, drobno pecivo in pekovski izdelki, da ne pozabimo na palačinke. Z njo po potrebi zgostimo omako, na hitro skuhamo preprosto, a okusno juho prežganko. In seveda iz nje so raznovrstne testenine pa štruklji, cmoki in druge prikuhe. V prehrani največ uporabljamo moko iz žit, med katerimi prednjači pšenica, danes pa lahko kupimo tudi moko iz na primer stročnic, zlasti čičerike, pa kokosovo ali riževo, ki so primerne tudi za ljudi, ki ne smejo uživati glutena.
Nižja ko je oznaka tipa moke, več snovi ji je bilo odstranjenih. 


Iz različnih vrst in tipov moke pečemo pisano paleto kruha. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images

V poplavi različnih izdelkov se je težko znajti, zato poglejmo, kaj pomenijo določene oznake tipa moke, ki marsikomu povzročajo preglavice. Za pšenično moko poznamo T400, T500, T850, T1100, tipi so določeni glede na vsebnost mineralnih snovi oziroma pepela: višji ko je tip, več mineralnih snovi moka vsebuje. Najbolj čiste vrste moke, zmlete iz jedra pšenice, so najnižjega tipa, polbele in črne imajo oznako tip 850 oziroma 1100, polnozrnate vsebujejo zmleta cela pšenična zrna. V moki pa ne najdemo samo mineralov, temveč tudi vitamine, celulozo, encime, ogljikove hidrate, zlasti škrob, ter beljakovine različnih količin in kakovosti. Nižja ko je številka tipa moke, več hranilnih snovi ji je bilo odstranjenih. Tako ima moka nižjih tipov več v vodi netopnih beljakovin, zato pri stiku v vodi tvori lepek, ki poskrbi, da bo testo dobro vzhajalo. Vrste moke se razlikujejo tudi po barvi, ki je posledica tega, kakšna pšenica se uporabi. Belo moko pripravljajo iz predhodno očiščene pšenice, in sicer samo osrednji del zrna. Ima odlične pecilne lastnosti. Za polbelo poleg osrednjega dela uporabijo tudi ovoj zrna, zato je bogatejša z vlakninami in minerali. Za črno pšenično poleg osrednjega dela pšeničnega zrna zmeljejo tudi obrobne dele, polnozrnata pa je pripravljena iz celih zrn, ne odstranijo niti otrobov niti kalčkov.Pri rženi moki, ki jo prav tako pogosto uporabljamo, so standardni tipi nekoliko drugačni, oznaka 750 je za belo rženo, polbela ržena ima oznako 950, črna 1250 in polnozrnata 1800. Ne glede na izbiro tipa moke vselej poglejmo datum mletja in uporabljajmo čim bolj svežo.

White, semi-white, black or full-grain?
We use many types of flour in the household, which also differ in type; this indicates the grinding method, the parts of the cereals and the content of the substance.
02 Nov 2019, 10:11 by Alenka Kociper



Rice is gluten free. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images



We still use the most cereal flour. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images



We bake a colorful pallet of bread from different types and types of flour. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images


Flour is an important part of your daily diet for most people; it includes bread, pizza, rolls and burek, cakes and other desserts, pastries and baked goods, not to forget the pancakes. If necessary, thicken the sauce with it, and quickly cook a simple but delicious broth. And of course, there are various pastas and dumplings, dumplings and other snacks. Wheat flour is predominantly used in the diet, but today we can also buy flour from, for example, legumes, especially chickpeas, coconut or rice, which are also suitable for people who should not consume gluten.
The lower the flour type designation, the more substance was removed.


We bake a colorful pallet of bread from different types and types of flour. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images

It is difficult to find yourself in the flood of different products, so let's look at what specific flour type designations mean to many people. Wheat flour is known as T400, T500, T850, T1100, the types are determined by the mineral content or ash content: the higher the type, the more mineral content the flour contains. The purest types of flour milled from the kernel of wheat are of the lowest type, semi-white and black having the types 850 and 1100 respectively, wholemeal containing ground whole wheat grains. But not only minerals are found in flour, but also vitamins, cellulose, enzymes, carbohydrates, especially starch, and proteins of varying quantities and qualities. The lower the flour type number, the more nutrients it has been removed. Thus, the flour of the lower types has more protein-insoluble protein, so when in contact with water it forms a glue that keeps the dough well rising. The types of flour also differ in color as a result of what kind of wheat is used. White flour is made from previously purified wheat, only the central part of the grain. It has excellent baking properties. In addition to the central part of the hemisphere, they also use a grain sheath, making it richer in fiber and minerals. For black wheat, in addition to the central part of the wheat grain, the marginal parts are ground and the whole grain is made from whole grains, eliminating neither bran nor sprouts. rye, semi-white rye is marked 950, black 1250 and whole grain 1800. Whatever the type of flour, always look at the grinding date and use it as fresh as possible.
